intro: Polygala cisandina, commonly known as the narrow-leaved milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, and it produces small, bean-like fruits. Polygala cisandina is often found in shrublands and along coastal areas, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
